content.en: Do you like potato chips, corn chips, or other crunchy food? Many gamers like crunchy food. They crunch on chips. They play games on their computers and crunch.
content.tw: 你喜歡吃酥脆的零食嗎? 很多遊戲玩家喜歡邊打電玩邊吃洋芋片。

content.en: Using a microphone, they talk to other gamers. Some gamers crunch and talk to other gamers... at the same time!
content.tw: 玩家會用麥克風跟其他的玩家對話，有一些玩家也會邊吃邊講話。

content.en: But many people don't like to hear crunching! It's annoying! But now Artificial Intelligence, or AI, can help. It erases crunching! How?
content.tw: 可是很多人不喜歡聽到這種討人厭的喀滋聲! 現在人工智慧 AI 可以幫忙消除噪音，怎麼做到的呢?

content.en: Five hundred people crunched chips in front of a microphone. They did this ten times. AI learned these 5,000 crunching sounds.
content.tw: 500個人在麥克風前吃洋芋片，每個人吃十次，讓 AI 學習這種噪音。

content.en: It also learned talking sounds. It learned that crunching and talking sounds are different. AI learned to erase crunching sounds but keep talking sounds.
content.tw: 它也學習分辨咀嚼聲跟說話的聲音，就可以消除噪音。

content.en: A company made an app that uses this AI. People can use this app with microphones on a computer. They hear themselves crunching. People in the same room hear them crunching. But... the people they're talking to on the computer don't hear crunching!
content.tw: 有公司利用這項 AI 技術研發出應用軟體，玩家把這個軟體用在電腦的麥克風上，就可以大快朵頤洋芋片，對方都聽不到。

content.en: With this app, you can crunch, crunch, crunch and talk to people on the computer. And you won't be annoying!
content.tw: 有了這個應用程式，你就可以在電腦前邊吃邊講話，而且不會讓人覺得討厭！

vocabulary.preface: 人工智慧應用軟體，可以消除吃東西的聲音!

content.text:
1. potato 馬鈴薯
Potato chips! 洋芋片!
Yeah, would you like some? 沒錯，你要吃一點嗎?
No. Potato chips are not good.不了，洋芋片不大好。

2. make 讓
They are too salty. 它太鹹了。
They make me thirsty. 會讓我口渴。
You're very careful with what you eat. 你對吃的東西真小心。
Are you sure you don't want some? 你確定不要來幾片?

3. corn 玉米
No, thank you. I prefer corn chips. 不了，多謝，我比較喜歡玉米片。
The ones without salt. 沒有鹽的那種。
Oh, I like those too. 我也喜歡那種。

4. in front of 在前面
I love sitting in front of the TV and eating corn chips and salsa.
我最愛坐在電視前面吃玉米片配莎莎醬。
Let's do it tonight.我們今晚就來吃。

vocabulary.postscript:
我們來讀今天的單字。
potato馬鈴薯
make讓
corn玉米
in front of在前面

quiz.question: 1. How many crunching sounds did AI learn?
2. What did AI learn to do with crunching sounds?
3. What is 'AI' short for?

content.en: Science is great! Science finds ways to help people. It's helping Mr. Oskam. Twelve years ago, he had a bad motorcycle accident. After the accident, his legs didn't work. He wasn't able to walk. He used a wheelchair for a long time.
content.tw: 12年前 Oskam先生遭遇車禍，雙腿無法行走，有很長一段時間需要依靠輪椅。

content.en: Then scientists put implants in Mr. Oskam's body. These implants are very small computers. He has two implants in his brain and one around his spine.
content.tw: 科學家在 Oskam 先生的腦袋跟脊椎植入訊號發射器。

content.en: Mr. Oskam also wears a special helmet. The implants, helmet, and a computer work together. Mr. Oskam carries the computer in a backpack on his back.
content.tw: 他也需要戴上特殊的頭盔，揹著裝有電腦的背包。

content.en: To move his legs, first Mr. Oskam thinks about moving them. His brain implants send a signal to the helmet. The helmet sends a signal to his spine implant. That implant sends a signal to his legs. Then his legs move!
content.tw: Oskam先生要先想著移動雙腿，他腦袋裡的發射器把訊號送到頭盔。再從頭盔送到脊椎，接著到他的雙腿，然後雙腿就可以移動了!

content.en: Mr. Oskam can walk slowly. He can stand and climb stairs too. And he can move more without help! He's very happy. Being able to move is very cool!
content.tw: 現在Oskam先生可以慢慢地走，也能站起來爬樓梯，不需要其他人幫忙，他真是開心極了!

content.en: Every day, scientists find new ways to help people. Helping people to walk again is great!
content.tw: 每天，科學家都在尋找新的方法來幫助人們。能夠再次幫助人們行走真是太棒了！

vocabulary.preface: 醫學科技讓這位受傷的人再度行走，是了不起的成就。

content.text:
1. leg 腿
Hey there! How are you holding up today? 嗨，你今天怎麼樣?
My legs are hurting after a long walk yesterday.
我現在腿痛，昨天走了太長的路。

2. walk 走路
Yeah? How long did you walk? 是嗎? 你走了多久?
About 10 minutes.大概十分鐘。
Only 10? 只有十分鐘?

3. brain 腦袋
Then I have to tell you, my brain hurts too.
那我得告訴你，我的腦袋也痛。
And the reason? 理由呢?
I had to climb that mountain of paperwork at the office.

4. able 能夠的
So your brain worked overtime? 所以你的腦袋超時工作?
Indeed.確實是。
Well, at least we are still able to move around. 至少我們都還能活動。
That's true. 你說對了。

vocabulary.postscript:
leg腿
walk走路
brain腦袋
able能夠的

quiz.question: 1. What kind of accident did Mr. Oskam have?
2. How many implants does Mr. Oskam have?
3. What does Mr. Oskam carry in a backpack?

content.en: Once upon a time, there were big dinosaurs living on Earth. Why did they go away?
content.tw: 很久以前，恐龍還活在地球上，那牠們為什麼消失了呢?

content.en: Some people say a very big space rock hit the Earth in Mexico. The "kaboom" was so big that it hit all the dinosaurs. Did this happen?
content.tw: 據說是一顆超大的隕石墜落在墨西哥，讓所有的恐龍滅亡。真的是這樣嗎?

content.en: Some smart scientists have another idea. They say the dinosaurs are gone because of volcanoes in India.
content.tw: 也有科學家覺得恐龍是因為印度的火山爆發而絕種。

content.en: Volcanoes are special mountains. They have holes on top! Volcanoes rumble and grumble. And they shoot out fire!
content.tw: 火山會隆隆作響，還會噴出火焰。

content.en: At the time of the dinosaurs, volcanoes shot out lots of fire and smoke. This happened for a very long time. This made the air very smelly.
content.tw: 當時有一段時間火山噴出大量火焰跟濃煙，讓空氣品質惡化。

content.en: After many years, the volcanoes changed the weather. The world got very cold. These scientists think this is why the dinosaurs are gone.
content.tw: 多年之後，火山爆發導致氣候變得很冷，科學家覺得這才是恐龍絕種的原因。

content.en: So, what made the dinosaurs go? Was it the volcanoes, the big space rock... or both? Scientists are not sure now, but their ideas are very interesting!
content.tw: 究竟是什麼原因讓恐龍消失呢? 是火山，是隕石，還是兩個都有? 科學家還不確定，但是他們的想法很有趣！

content.en: Today, scientists look for rocks and dinosaur bones in the ground. This helps them learn more about what happened to the dinosaurs!
content.tw: 今天，科學家們在地下尋找岩石和恐龍骨骼。這有助於他們了解更多關於恐龍滅絕的原因！

vocabulary.preface: 有一個理論說火山爆發導致氣候改變，恐龍也因此滅絕。

content.text:
1. shoot 噴發
Can you imagine Datun Mountain erupting one day? 你能想像有一天大屯山爆發嗎?
And shooting out fire and ash? 然後噴出火焰和灰塵?
That would be so cool! 那好酷喔!
No, it wouldn't. 才不呢。

2. because 因為
Our weather may change because the ash would block the
sun.我們的天氣可能改變，因為火山灰會遮住太陽。

3. for a long time 長時間
But Datun Mountain has slept for a very long time. 但是大屯山已經沉睡很久了。
With volcanoes, you never know. 火山是說不準的。

4. scientist 科學家
I'm not worried. We have good scientists. 我不擔心，我們有很好的科學家。
Yeah, let's hope they don't fall asleep.對啊，希望他們不會睡著。

vocabulary.postscript:
請跟我讀今天的單字。
shoot噴發
because因為
for a long time長時間
scientist科學家

quiz.question: 1. Where did the big space rock hit the Earth?
2. What shoots out of volcanoes?
3. What do scientists look for to learn about dinosaurs?

content.en: Do you know what people say about stinky tofu? The worse it smells, the better it tastes!
content.tw: 大家都說臭豆腐越臭越好吃。

content.en: In Europe, people say the same about cheese. They have lots of cheeses over there. What's the weirdest one? Mite cheese.
content.tw: 歐洲人也說起司越臭越好吃，他們有各種起司，最奇怪的是螨起司。

content.en: No, no, no! It's not MICE cheese! It's MITE cheese! Mites are very small spiders. They make cheese using their poop!
content.tw: 螨很像小的蜘蛛，牠們的排泄物可以用來做起司。

content.en: Mr. Poschel was a biology teacher. Now he farms mites. He has lots of dark, cool, moist boxes. They're full of millions of mites! He needs them to make mite cheese.
content.tw: Poschel先生以前是生物老師。他現在養螨，把牠們養在潮濕陰暗的箱子來做起司。

content.en: Mr. Poschel puts soft cheese into the boxes. Then the hungry mites get to work! They climb all over it! Eating and pooping, pooping and eating. Eat. Poop. Eat. Poop. Eat. Poop. They're making mite cheese!
content.tw: Poschel先生把軟質乳酪放進箱子裡，螨會爬到起司上，邊吃邊排泄。

content.en: Mr. Poschel waits for the mite cheese to get hard. Then he takes it out of the boxes. He's very careful. These mites eat fingernails too!
content.tw: 等到起司變硬了，就可以從箱子裡拿出來。他很小心，這些螨也會吃指甲。

content.en: His mite cheese is ready to eat. Some say it's tasty. Others want to try it. Spider poop cheese? No, thanks or yes, please?
content.tw: 他的螨起司已經可以吃了。有人說它很美味。也有人想嚐嚐看。蜘蛛便便起司？不，謝謝還是請給我來一點？

vocabulary.preface: 螨起司的做法真特別，有點兒異想天開。

content.text:
1. smell 聞起來
What's that you're eating? 你在吃什麼呢?
Seafood soup. 海鮮湯。
It smells very strong.聞起來味道很重。
Yeah, I added fish sauce.對，我加了魚露。

2. taste 嚐起來
This actually tastes really good. 它其實很好吃。
You made it yourself? 你自己做的?
Right, I learned it from a Thai teacher. 對，我從一個泰國老師學來的。

3. lots of 很多的
I know fish sauce is used in lots of Thai dishes.我知道很多泰國菜都用魚露。
Come, have some. 來吧，吃一點。
Wow! Delicious! 哇，真好吃!
I knew you'd like it.我就知道你會喜歡。

4. full of 充滿的
This soup is full of flavor! 這個湯味道濃郁。
Yeah, it's better than other kinds of soup. 它比別的湯都好。
Because it's easy to make.因為它很容易做。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like cheese or Thai food? 來複習一遍單字。
smell聞起來
taste嚐起來
lots of很多的
full of充滿的

quiz.question: 1. What kind of cheese is made from spider poop?
2. What does Mr. Poschel keep in dark, cool, moist boxes?
3. What eats fingernails?

title: Customers Think Woman is a Robot

content.en: Do you like to pretend? Some kids pretend to be cowboys or cowgirls riding horses. Others pretend to drive fast cars. Some kids pretend to be robots.
content.tw: 有的小朋友喜歡裝成牛仔騎馬或是假裝開快車，有的也會裝成機器人。

content.en: Many people like robots in restaurants. People like to tell these robots what they want to eat. Robots are cool!
content.tw: 很多人喜歡餐廳裡的機器人，覺得它們很酷，也喜歡跟它們點餐。

content.en: In China, Ms. Qin pretends to be a robot. This woman owns a restaurant. She pretends there.
content.tw: 在中國，有一位秦小姐在她的火鍋店裡裝作是個機器人。

content.en: Ms. Qin takes customers to their tables. She walks with many small moves. She moves and stops, moves and stops.
content.tw: 秦小姐幫客人帶位時，她用許多小小的移動來走路，移動，停，移動，停。

content.en: Ms. Qin doesn't look happy or sad. Her face and her eyes don't move. Many new customers think she's a robot!
content.tw: 她的臉跟眼睛一動也不動，看不出她是開心還是難過，很多新客人覺得她是一個機器人。

content.en: News reporters heard about Ms. Qin. They went to her restaurant. They asked her questions. They found out she wasn't a robot!
content.tw: 記者到她的火鍋店採訪，才發現她根本不是機器人。

content.en: Ms. Qin likes to pretend to be a robot. Why? It's because she likes to dance. She's a good dancer, so she can move well.
content.tw: 那秦小姐為什麼喜歡扮成機器人呢?因為她喜歡跳舞，也是一位厲害的舞者。

content.en: Now many people know Ms. Qin is not a robot. But they like to watch her pretend to be a robot!
content.tw: 現在很多人都知道秦小姐不是機器人。但他們還是喜歡看她假裝成機器人！

vocabulary.preface: 假裝成機器人，這還真需要一點本領。

content.text:
1. kid 小孩
If you could pretend to be someone else, who would you like to be?
要是你可以假裝成別人，你想假裝成誰呢?
George Clooney's wife? 喬治克隆尼的太太?
No, be serious. 認真一點。
Okay, the kid in Wonka.電影《旺卡》裡的小孩。

2. walk 走路
So I could walk through the chocolate factory.
我就可以走過巧克力工廠。
That sounds magical! 聽起來很夢幻。

3. drive 駕駛
I'd like to drive a spacecraft.
我想要駕駛太空船。
You don't drive.不是駕駛太空船。
You fly a spacecraft. 你開太空船。

4. dancer 跳舞者
I thought you'd like to be a dancer.
我以為你想當跳舞的人。
I don't need to pretend. 我不需要假裝。
I'm already a dancer. 我已經是舞者。

quiz.question: 1. What is Ms. Qin?
2. What does Ms. Qin like to do?
3. What does Ms. Qin pretend to be?

postscript:
Let's read the words.
kid小孩
walk走路
drive駕駛
dancer跳舞者

title: Chinstrap Penguins Are the Best Nap Masters

content.en: Hey! Wake up! Why are you napping? Are you a chinstrap penguin? They love to nap!
content.tw: 嘿！醒醒！你為什麼在打瞌睡？你是一隻帽帶企鵝嗎？牠們很愛打瞌睡！

content.en: These penguins have a black line under their chin. They look like they're wearing motorcycle helmets with chin straps. They're chinstrap penguins.
content.tw: 這些企鵝的下巴有一條黑色的紋路，看起像戴了安全帽一樣，他們是帽帶企鵝。

content.en: Scientists are studying chinstrap penguins in Antarctica. And you know what? They found out something new!
content.tw: 科學家研究南極的帽帶企鵝，他們有新的發現。

content.en: Chinstrap penguins take more than 10,000 naps a day! Each nap is about four seconds long. That's very short! One minute is 60 seconds long! These penguins don't need alarm clocks!
content.tw: 帽帶企鵝一天打瞌睡超過1萬次，一次大約只有4秒。

content.en: All those four-second naps give chinstrap penguins 11 hours of sleep a day. That's a lot! But they have work to do too. They take care of their eggs. They keep their eggs safe from other animals. And they find food in the ocean.
content.tw: 每4秒累積下來，帽帶企鵝一天可以睡11個小時。牠們還要孵蛋、保護企鵝蛋跟覓食。

content.en: Chinstrap penguins sleep, work, and repeat. Sleep is important for them... and us! We also need to sleep for the energy to do great things!
content.tw: 帽帶企鵝不停地睡覺跟工作，睡眠對牠們很重要。我們也需要睡眠才有活力做事。

content.en: Scientists are finding out more about sleep from the best nap masters. Let's take a four-second nap... Voice: Hey! Wake up! Narrator: Oh … OK! I'm awake, I'm awake!
content.tw: 科學家們正從這些最會打瞌睡的大師身上，發現更多關於睡眠的秘密。我們也來打個四秒鐘的瞌睡吧… 聲音：嘿！醒醒！旁白：喔…好！我醒了，我醒了！

vocabulary.preface: 帽帶企鵝喜歡睡覺，但是他們每次睡眠的時間非常短。

content.text:
1. wake up 醒來
I'm so tired! 我好累。
Didn't sleep well last night? 昨晚沒睡好?
Right, I woke up at least 3 times. 對啊，我醒來三次。

2. motorcycle 摩托車
The motorcycles outside were so noisy! 外面的摩托車吵得要命!
That's really annoying. 那真的很討厭。

3. minute 分鐘
Sorry, I can't help it. 真抱歉，我忍不住。
Go take a nap. 去睡一下吧。
You'll feel a lot better after just 10 minutes of sleep. 睡個十分鐘你也會覺得好很多。

4. hour 小時
No, 10 minutes is too short. 不，十分鐘太短了。
I need hours of sleep now. 我現在需要睡好幾個鐘頭。
Then what are you waiting for? 那你還在等什麼?
Just go. 就去吧。

vocabulary.postscript:
你每天睡得夠嗎? 來讀單字。
wake up醒來
motorcycle摩托車
minute分鐘
hour小時

quiz.question: 1. Where do chinstrap penguins live?
2. How many naps do chinstrap penguins take a day?
3. Where do chinstrap penguins find food?

content.en: What's this smelly thing? Ewww! It's cow poop! Scientists call it cow dung. Most people want to throw it away. It smells bad! But guess what? It can be very useful!
content.tw: 科學家把牛糞叫做 cow dung，牛糞雖然很臭，但其實非常有用!

content.en: In Japan, a space company wants to use cow dung fuel to make rockets fly! Whoa!
content.tw: 日本有一家太空公司想把牛糞當作火箭的燃料。

content.en: Rockets need to fly very high and very fast. They need special fuel. Now a gas company makes this fuel with cow dung!
content.tw: 火箭飛得又高又快， 所以需要特殊的燃料。有一間汽油公司就把牛糞做成了火箭燃料。

content.en: The space company tested the rocket fuel. Its rocket shot out blue and orange fire! Everyone was very happy. The rocket can work with the cow dung fuel!
content.tw: 太空公司測試這種燃料，成功點燃了火箭，噴出藍色、橘色的火焰。

content.en: Using cow dung for fuel is good. Cow dung is cheap. Farmers have lots of it... and every day, there's mooooo-re! And using it instead of oil helps the Earth.
content.tw: 牛糞燃料是個好主意，農夫每天都可以提供很多牛糞，而且它很便宜，用來取代燃油也很環保。

content.en: For Japan, using cow dung is important. Japan doesn't have its own oil. But they can make energy from cow dung. They can make gas to heat homes and make trucks go. And now they make the special rocket fuel!
content.tw: 日本沒有石油，但是可以用牛糞產生動力，用在暖氣、貨車，現在也可以用在火箭上。

content.en: Maybe one day, cow poop will fly a rocket to the moooooo-n!
content.tw: 也許有一天，牛糞會讓火箭飛到月球！

vocabulary.preface: 牛糞居然可以做火箭燃料，想不到吧?

content.text:
1. orange 橘子、橘色的
Are you making a lantern? 你在做燈籠嗎?
I wish. 我希望是。
No, I'm making a kite.不過我是在做風箏。
An orange and blue kite? 橘色跟藍色的風箏?
Yeah, bright colors look pretty in the sky.對啊，鮮豔的顏色在天上很好看。

2. can 可以、能
When do you plan to fly it? 你準備什麼時候去放?
Right after I'm done.就在做好之後。
Wow, can I go with you? 哇，我可以跟你一起去嗎?
Sure.當然。

3. use 使用
How do you know what materials to use? 你怎麼知道用什麼材料?
Well, I googled. 我查了谷歌。

4. cheap 便宜的
I like kites. 我喜歡風箏。
They are cheap and lots of fun. 又便宜又好玩。

vocabulary.postscript:
Let's read today's words.
orange橘子、橘色的
can可以、能
use使用
cheap便宜的

quiz.question: 1. What do scientists call "cow poop"?
2. Where is cow poop used for rockets?
3. Why is using cow poop good?

title: Big Sea Monster Found in the UK

content.en: There's a big sea monster in the UK. It looks very scary. It's twelve meters long. That's as big as a house!
content.tw: 英國發現一隻巨大的海怪，牠長達12公尺，跟一棟房子一樣大。

content.en: It has a lizard's head. But its skull is two meters long! And its mouth has one hundred thirty sharp teeth. This monster might eat you in one bite!
content.tw: 牠的頭部像蜥蜴，光是頭骨就長達兩公尺，還有130顆牙齒。

content.en: Ahhh! Thinking about it makes me scared. But do we need to be afraid of this sea monster? Don't worry. It's okay. This animal is NOT alive. Scientists found its skull.
content.tw: 我們需要擔心這頭海怪嗎? 完全不用，因為牠早就死了。科學家找到牠的頭骨。

content.en: This animal lived 150 million years ago. That was the time of dinosaurs. This big sea monster is a pliosaur. Pliosaur means "more lizard"!
content.tw: 牠生活在1億5千萬年前恐龍的時代，這頭巨大的海怪是「上龍」。

content.en: Long, long ago, it was the king of the ocean. The pliosaur used its four strong flippers to swim very fast. Any other fish or ocean animal was its food.
content.tw: 很久以前，上龍是海洋的掠食者，牠強壯的四肢讓牠游得非常快。

content.en: But now it's a fossil. Its teeth and bones are now stones. Scientists want to study this pliosaur. They hope to learn more about this real-world sea monster.
content.tw: 但牠現在變成了化石。科學家想要研究上龍，希望對這頭真的海怪了解更多。

content.en: What? You see a big sea monster? Don't worry, it's not a pliosa …
content.tw: 什麼？你看到一隻大海怪？別擔心，那不是一隻上龍…

vocabulary.preface: 上龍可不是童話故事裡的海怪，牠真的在地球上生活過。

content.text: 1. skull 頭骨 Hey, I just came back from an adventure! 我剛剛探險回來。 Really? What happened? 真的嗎?發生了什麼事? I was at this dinosaur museum, and saw a giant T-Rex skull. 我去恐龍博物館，看到一個巨大的暴龍頭骨。
2. as big as 一樣大 It's as big as my body! 跟我的身體一樣大! No way! 不可能! But it's true. 是真的。
3. scary 讓人害怕的 It's very scary. 它很嚇人。 Okay, what else did you see? 好吧,你還看到什麼? A fish fossil that has hundreds of teeth! 一個魚的化石，有好幾百顆牙齒!
4. teeth 牙齒 Why so many teeth? 為什麼有那麼多牙齒? To eat other monsters? 好來吃別的怪物?

vocabulary.postscript: 請跟我一起讀單字。skull頭骨as big as一樣大scary讓人害怕的teeth牙齒

quiz.question: 1. Where was the sea monster found?
2. How many meters long is the sea monster?
3. What is the sea monster called?

content.en: Narrator: Around the world, millions of buses make lots of smoke. The smoke makes air pollution. Countries are trying to make their air cleaner. How is China fighting air pollution?
content.tw: 世界各地的公車排放很多廢氣。很多國家想要更乾淨的空氣，中國是如何對抗空氣污染呢?

content.en: China's cities are using many electric buses, or e-buses. E-buses don't make smoke! They charge their batteries at their bus garage. Then they all drive to their bus stops. They drive about two hundred kilometers a day!
content.tw: 中國用很多電動公車。他們先充電，再前往各個車站，每天大約行駛200公里。

content.en: China has the most e-buses in the world. Voices: REALLY?! Narrator: Shenzhen, a big city there, is the first city in the world to have all e-buses!
content.tw: 中國有全世界最多的電動公車。深圳是第一個全面使用電動公車的城市。

content.en: E-buses are easy to use in China. They are everywhere! And in L?li?ng, a small city, e-bus rides are free!
content.tw: 中國到處都是電動公車。在呂梁市還可以免費搭乘。

content.en: But e-buses also have problems. Making batteries and buses also makes pollution. And batteries don't work well in cold weather.
content.tw: 但是電動公車也有缺點。製造電池跟公車會造成汙染。天氣冷的時候，電池也沒辦法運作。

content.en: China is working on these problems. Other countries are watching and learning.
content.tw: 中國正在改善這些問題，其他的國家都很注意，同時也在學習。

content.en: Here in Taiwan, all buses will be electric by 2030. Will Taiwan be the first country to have all e-buses? Electric buses help us fight air pollution. Let's ride these clean-air heroes on wheels!
content.tw: 2030年所有本地公車都會變成電動，這會不會讓台灣成為世上第一個完全使用電動公車的國家？電動公車幫助我們對抗空氣污染。讓我們搭乘這些移動的清淨空氣英雄吧！

vocabulary.preface: 越來越多城市，打算擴大使用電動公車。

content.text: 1. electric 電動的 Oh, my, I can hardly breathe! Yeah, it really smells bad. They should switch to electric buses.
2. air 空氣 I agree. It would be so much quieter. And much cleaner air.
3. smoke 煙霧 Nowadays I don't take the bus any more. Because of the smoke from traffic? Exactly!
4. drive 駕駛 Also because I've learned to drive. Oh no, more pollution.

vocabulary.postscript: 請跟我讀單字。electric電動的 air空氣 smoke煙霧 drive駕駛

quiz.question: 1. Why is China using e-buses?
2. Where do the e-buses charge?
3. When will Taiwan have all e-buses?

title: A Festival for People Born on Leap Day

content.en: Twenty-seven, twenty-eight, twenty-nine... Wait, there are twenty-nine days this February! Today is a leap day!
content.tw: 今年二月有二十九天，今天是閏日。

content.en: Can you wait to have your birthday once every four years? Well, about five million people around the world were born on a leap day. These people are called leaplings.
content.tw: 你能等四年才過一次生日嗎? 全世界差不多有500萬人在閏日出生。

content.en: After a birthday, leaplings wait for four years for the next one! And they finally have their birthday this year! They're jumping for joy!
content.tw: 這些人今年終於可以過生日了，過完這一次他們需要等四年才能過下一次生日。

content.en: Anthony, a small town in Texas, is the Leap Year Capital of the World. This American town is having a three-day Leap Year Festival! It starts tonight! Leaplings from all around the world are going to this big birthday party.
content.tw: 德州安東尼小鎮舉辦為期三天的閏日慶典。從今晚開始，來自全世界的壽星會前往這個盛大的生日派對。

content.en: Imagine the sight of fun attractions, the smell and taste of delicious foods, and the sound of cheerful music. At the Leap Year Festival, there will be games, food, and live music for everyone!
content.tw: 閏日慶典會有遊戲、食物還有現場的音樂表演。

content.en: Today is a very special day, especially in the Leap Year Capital of the World! Happy Birthday, leaplings! Have a slice or four of birthday cake and have a fabulous, leap-tastic day!
content.tw: 今天是個非常特別的日子，特別是在世界閏年之都！閏年寶寶們生日快樂！吃片或四片生日蛋糕，祝你們有個美妙的、閏年限定的一天！

vocabulary.preface: 美國德州有一個小鎮，喜歡替二月29號出生的人舉辦派對。

content.text: 1. delicious 美味的 Wow, what smells so good? 什麼東西這麼香? It's my roast chicken.是我的烤雞。 Oh, it must be delicious! 一定很好吃!
2. special 特別的 Yes, it's for a special party tonight. 是為了今晚的特別派對。 You're having the party at home? 在家裡辦派對嗎? No, at the town hall.不是，是在里民中心。
3. live music 現場音樂 We'll have live music, food and drinks. 我們有現場音樂，食物和飲料。 What is it for? 是為什麼呢?
4. born 出生 For all the people born before 1950. 為了1950年之前出生的人。 I didn't know old people love parties. 我不知道老年人也喜歡派對。 Everyone loves parties.每個人都喜歡派對。

vocabulary.postscript: Do you like parties? Let's read the words. delicious美味的 special特別的 live music現場音樂 born出生

quiz.question: 1. How long do leaplings wait for their birthdays?
2. Where is the Leap Year Capital of the World?
3. How many days is the Leap Year Festival?
